alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 6:48PM PST until January 15 at 3:29AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The Chehalis River at Porter will continue to slowly recede tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...The Chehalis River remains close to minor flood stage. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 46.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor County will locally spill over its banks with shallow water on several roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 47.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM PST Friday was 48.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 39.8 feet Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 330 AM PST.
